step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see List view

2. Hover mouse over any pin placeholder at the end of row, verify tooltip

3. Click on pin placeholder, verify pinned product

4. Select that pinned product, perform moving that product, verify locking position
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with list view is shown

2. A tooltip shows "Click and lock a position of this product in this category"

3. Position of the selected product is pinned

4. That product position is locked, user cannot move it any way

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see List view

2. Hover mouse over any pinned product at the end of row, verify tooltip

3. Click on pin icon, verify unpinned position

4. Select that unpinned product, perform moving that product, verify unlocked position
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with list view is shown

2. A tooltip shows "Position of this product is pinned. Click to remove the pin"

3. Position of the selected product is unpinned

4. That product position is changed

testcase.name: Pinning_3
testcase.summary: List view - Verify moving/ dragging/dropping products over pinned products
testcase.preconditions: Some products exist under a category - Every page shows 10 products - Some products are pinned at ordinal 3, 5

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see List view

2. Select a row > input the position of pinned item to textbox then press enter or mouse out of textbox

3. Select a row > move down/up over pinned position by down/up arrow

4. Select a row > move over pinned position by dragging/dropping
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with default List view is shown

2. The number is reversed back to the its value

3, 4. The selected row is moved down/up over pinned item. The near items will be pushed up/down

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see Grid view

2. Hover mouse over any pin placeholder at header bar of grid cell, verify tooltip

3. Click on pin placeholder, verify pinned product

4. Select that pinned product, perform moving that product, verify locked position
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with grid view (directory) is shown

2. A tooltip shows "Click and lock a position of this product in this category"

3. Position of the selected product is pinned

4. That product position is locked, user cannot move it

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see Grid view

2. Click on pin icon, verify unpinned position

3. Select that unpinned product, perform moving that product, verify unlocked position
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with grid view .is shown

2. Position of the selected product is unpinned

3. That product position is changed

testcase.name: Pinning_6
testcase.summary: Grid view (Directory) - Verify moving/ dragging/dropping products over pinned products
testcase.preconditions: Some products exist under a category - Every page shows 10 products - Some products are pinned at ordinal 3, 5

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see Grid view

2. Select cell 1, edit the ordinal to 3, then move mouse out of textbox

3. Press Right arrow and again

4. Select cell 6, press Left arrow

5. Continue selecting cell up and down the pinned position and try to click up/down arrow

6. Reproduce similar steps from 3 - 6 but drag/drop a cell left/right, it will be moved left/right over pinned products but the pinned position 3 and 5 will not be replaced or moved
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with Grid view (directory) is shown

2. The number is reverted back to the previous number

3.The selected cell is moved until it touches the pinned position. The pinned position will not be moved to any where

4. The cell is not moved when it touches the pinned position. The pinned position will not be moved to any where

5. The selected cell is not moved when it touches the pinned position. The pinned position is not moved to any where

6. The selected product will be moved left/right over the pinned positions but the pinned positions 3, 5 will not be replaced or moved

testcase.name: Pinning_7
testcase.summary: Grid view (Fit to width) - Verify pinning product

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize > click icon Grid View > click hyperlink Fit to Width

2. Hover mouse over any pin placeholder at the top of cell, verify tooltip

3. Click on pin placeholder, verify pinned product

4. Select that pinned product, perform moving that product, verify locked position
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with fit to width view is shown

2. A tooltip shows "Click and lock a position of this product in this category"

3. Position of the selected product is pinned

4. That product position is locked, user cannot move it

testcase.name: Pinning_8
testcase.summary: Grid view (Fit to width) - Verify unpinning product

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize > click icon Grid View > click hyperlink Fit to Width

2. Hover mouse over any pinned product at the top of cell, verify tooltip

3. Click on pin icon, verify unpinned position

4. Select that unpinned product, perform moving that product, verify unlocked position
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with fit to width view is shown

2. A tooltip shows "Position of this product is pinned. Click to remove the pin"

3. Position of the selected product is unpinned

4. That product position is changed

testcase.name: Pinning_9
testcase.summary: Grid view (Fit to width) - Verify moving/ dragging/dropping products over pinned products
testcase.preconditions: Some products exist under a category - Every page shows 10 products - Some products are pinned

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize > click icon Grid View > click hyperlink Fit to Width

2. Select cell 1, edit the ordinal to 3, then move mouse out of textbox or press enter

3. Select any cell and press left/right/up/down around the pinned position.

4. Reproduce similar steps from 3 - 6 but drag/drop a row up/down/left/right, it will be moved up/down/left/right over pinned products but the pinned position 3 and 5 will not be replaced
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with fit to width view is shown

2. The item will be moved to next or previous row of the pinned item

3. The selected cell is moved left/right/up/down until it touches the pinned position. The pinned position will not be moved to any where.

4. The selected product will be moved up/down/left/right over the pinned positions but the pinned positions 3, 5 will not be replaced

testcase.name: Pinning_10
testcase.summary: Grid view (Fit to width) - Verify page style attributes

step.actions:
1. Verify the style for a selected product line by simple mouse click

2. Verify the style of a selected product line by Ctrl/Shift/Draw box

3. Verify the style for a non-selected product line

4. Verify the style for a mouse over product line

5. Verify the style for a pinned product line: non-selected and no mouseover
step.expectedresults:
1. - Empty pin

2. - Empty pin

3. - Empty pin

4. - Empty pin

5. - Display pin - Not selected line

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see Thumbnail view

2. Hover mouse over any pin placeholder at the end of row, verify tooltip

3. Click on pin placeholder, verify pinned product

4. Select that pinned product, perform moving that product, verify locking position
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with thumbnail view is shown

2. A tooltip shows "Click and lock a position of this product in this category"

3. Position of the selected product is pinned

4. That product position is locked, user cannot move it

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see Thumbnail view

2. Hover mouse over any pinned product at the end of row, verify tooltip

3. Click on pin icon, verify unpinned position

4. Select that unpinned product, perform moving that product, verify unlocked position
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with thumbnail view is shown

2. A tooltip shows "Position of this product is pinned. Click to remove the pin"

3. Position of the selected product is unpinned

4. That product position is changed

testcase.name: Pinning_13
testcase.summary: Thumbnail View - Verify moving/ dragging/dropping products over pinned product

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > select a product category > Select tab Organize, select to see Thumbnail view

2. Select row 1, edit the ordinal to 3, then move mouse out of textbox, verify warning message

3. Press down arrow to ordinal 2, then continue moving down, verify ordinal of pinned product

4. Continue moving down, verify ordinal of pinned product

5. Select row 6, press up arrow, verify ordinal of pinned product

6. Continue moving up, verify ordinal of pinned product

7. Reproduce similar steps from 3 - 6 but drag/drop a row up/down, it will be moved up/down over pinned products but the pinned position 3 and 5 will not be replaced
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with thumbnail view is shown

2. A warning message is shown about pinned position

3.The selected row is moved down to ordinal 4, the position 3 will not be replaced

4. The selected row is moved down to ordinal 6, the position 5 will not be replaced

5. The selected row is moved up to ordinal 4, the position 3 will not be replaced

6. The selected row is moved up to ordinal 2, the position 5 will not be replaced

7. The selected product will be moved up/down over the pinned positions but the pinned positions 3, 5 will not be replaced

step.actions:
1. Admin > Sites > Select a product category > Select tab Organize, select Thumbnail View

2. Select position number 1, pin it

3. Unpin position number 1, move it down to ordinal 2

4. Select ordinal 1, pin it

5. Select ordinal 2 and 3, move them down to ordinal 5,6
step.expectedresults:
1. Organize tab with thumbnail view is shown

2. Position number 1 is pinned

3. Selected item is moved down to ordinal 3

4. Selected item is pinned

5. The selected items are moved to ordinal 5, 6 as expectation and the pinned item at the position 1 is still kept

step.actions:
1. Admin > navigate to Organize tab of category

2. Pin some products

3. Try to sort the list by column header such as Position, Valid, Product Code, Product Name, .... and other custom columns

4. Pull down menu and select to sort by New Arrivals

5. Try to sort by other criteria in Sort By in pulled-down menu
step.expectedresults: 3-5. The product list is sorted except the pinned position. Entire pinned position is not changed. The position and ordinal number are not changed until Save Changes is applied

step.actions: 1. Click hyperlink "Change" near the View Columns, verify a list of viewable columns is shown 2. Add or remove attributes by sign '+' or '-' 3. Verify columns are added or removed based on setting
step.expectedresults: 1. A list of columns is expanded - Price, Inventory, Status, Rating: static attributes - default selection - On Sale, New Arrival, Active date, Sale rank: static attributes - Number of reviews, New Item, Product Categories, SKUs, Brand name, Best Sellers,... 2. The selected columns can be added or removed to view columns list 3. The columns are added to or removed out on the header columns

step.actions: 1. Admin > Libraries > Attributes > Product > add some custom attributes 2. Sites > Product Categories > Organize tab > toggle filter 3. Verify custom attributes in Sort By list 4. Choose one of custom attribute to sort by, verify product list sorting in grid
step.expectedresults: 1. Custom attributes should be added correctly 2. Filter is toggled 3. Custom attributes are auto-detected and added to Sort By list 4. On the first time filtering, products list is sorted in ascending, on the second time, it's sorted in descending

testcase.name: Custom_Attributes Prod-8159:PEBL-5539-18
testcase.preconditions: Product Organize tab - Thumbnail view is selected

step.actions: "1. Toggle the filter, verify criteria 2. Edit some criteria, then reset to default 3. Toggle the filter again, verify filtering the product list"
step.expectedresults: "1. A menu is pulled down, default criteria includes: - Display: Active & Inactive (default selected), Active Only, Inactive Only - Families: Family Leaders and Members (selected by default), Family Leaders Only - Sort By: Our picks, New Arrivals, A to Z & Z to A) - Reset to Default: hyperlink - Apply: hyperlink 2. All changes are reset to default 3. Toggle filter is pulled up, the product list is filtered by criteria"

step.actions: "1. Click hyperlink ""Change"" near the View Columns, verify a list of viewable columns is shown 2. Add or remove attributes by sign '+' or '-' 3. Verify columns are added or removed based on setting"
step.expectedresults: "1. A list of columns is expanded - Price, Inventory, Status, Rating: static attributes - default selection - On Sale, New Arrival, Active date, Sale rank: static attributes - Number of reviews, New Item, Product Categories, SKUs, Brand name, Best Sellers,... 2. The selected columns can be added or removed to view columns list 3. The columns are added to or removed out on the header columns"

step.actions: "1. Admin > Libraries > Attributes > Product > add some custom attributes 2. Sites > Product Categories > Organize tab > toggle filter 3. Verify custom attributes in Sort By list 4. Choose one of custom attribute to sort by, verify product list sorting in grid"
step.expectedresults: "1. Custom attributes should be added correctly 2. Filter is toggled 3. Custom attributes are auto-detected and added to Sort By list 4. On the first time filtering, products list is sorted in ascending, on the second time, it's sorted in descending"
